definition: to accuse/to denounce/to make a complaint against/denunciation
to control/to accuse/to charge/to sue/to invert a container to empty it/(suffix) (slang) buff/enthusiast/devotee/-phile or -philia

sentences.english: This is intolerable, but it isn't an indictment of growth itself.
sentences.chinese: 这是难以忍受的，但它不能作为控诉经济增长的借口。

sentences.english: Fort Worth has countered with a lawsuit, which is pending in the U.S. Court of Appeals.
sentences.chinese: 因此沃思堡将面临联邦上诉法院的控诉。

sentences.english: The caller complained, “I’ve been sad all my life.
sentences.chinese: 来访者控诉道，“终其一生，我都悲伤难抑。

sentences.english: Both the prosecution and the defence may call witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 控诉方和被告都可以传召证人。

sentences.english: Assuming the charges are true, few should weep for Minister Zheng.
sentences.chinese: 假如这些控诉是真的，很少人会为郑筱萸流泪。

sentences.english: They charged that the press is romanticizing gangsterism.
sentences.chinese: 他们控诉报纸将匪盗行为传奇化。

sentences.english: An indictment or information is presented to the court, and a formal arraignment on the charges is held.
sentences.chinese: 起诉方向法院提供起诉状，根据控诉正式传讯被告。

sentences.english: And charges have been filed in connection with this bench -clearing brawl.
sentences.chinese: 这场球场上的争吵已被提起控诉。

sentences.english: Female rock singers' lyrics works reflect the awakening of female consciousness in China from different respect.
sentences.chinese: 何勇则在摇滚歌词中反映并控诉社会的阴暗面。

sentences.english: The realization of the private prosecution right must be based on the raise of private prosecutors' capability to appeal.
sentences.chinese: 自诉权的实现必须以提升自诉人的控诉能力为基础。

sentences.english: Wilson is charged with petit theft and resisting recovery of property.
sentences.chinese: 威尔士以小偷小盗和持续取回财产的抗辩而被控诉。

sentences.english: Indictment delivered to him last night.
sentences.chinese: 控诉书昨夜已交该犯本人。

sentences.english: For nearly 40 years, Gordimer has spoken out against apartheid.
sentences.chinese: 接近40年了，戈迪默大声控诉种族隔离政策。

sentences.english: Letters of complaint are still flooding into the office.
sentences.chinese: 控诉信仍不断地寄到办公室。

sentences.english: US accuse China for setting export duties and quotas on them.
sentences.chinese: 美国控诉中国对原材料设置出口税及出口配额。

definition: to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to expose/to unmask/to ferret out/to disclose/disclosure
variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
to question/to ask questions/to inquire/to bring to account/to interrogate
to shed tears while recounting sth/speaking in a tearful voice
